entry.title: New release for Dribdat: v0.8.9
entry.content:
This release includes incremental usability improvements to security and content generation. A new feature allows you to click on the project tags (a.k.a. Technai) near the Team area, and get a list of people who have these skills in their profile. The same with Roles: except that now we properly (and more efficiently) search the whole server. People have been asking us to do away with passwords, so now it is possible to register and log-in through e-mail alone. We have made the Post editor much easier to use by enabling the Markdown editor (you can still turn it off, if you prefer). The text editor has been changed to EasyMDE. The full list of improvements is below.

Please note, we are in the process of transitioning to Codeberg with this release. Most links are still pointing to GitHub.

üåê Demo: Open Data Day :tada:

:+1: Published at Workspace & More :heart_decoration: Supported by HSLU :school: and Opendata.ch :switzerland:

üèÄ Download from Docker Hub, GitHub or Codeberg.

üëÅÔ∏è‚Äçüó®Ô∏è Please leave us your feedback in the Discussion area!

Improvements

  • Post editor now has Markdown enabled (globally toggled in the Editor)
  • Refactored tip and recommender generator for better AI-generated advice.
  • A description written in the Stages YAML is used for AI prompts on each stage.
  • Remove LLM button on challenges, even if they are AI-generated, it still takes a team!
  • A small update to the style of the timeline that is more allowing for Markdown formatting like headers in the dribs.
  • Auto-evaluations are saved using a separate 'action' so they get a different icon and are more easily filterable.
  • Your user profile name and a link to "My Story" added in the People screen.
  • The rich text editor has been changed from tui.editor to EasyMDE
  • "GitHub Style" Markdown mode enabled for strikethrough and linkify formatting.
  • When users enter an unknown e-mail address, they can get a registration link*
  • (* This behavior can be disabled through DRIBDAT_NOT_REGISTER see #460)
  • The LLM dialog has been revised slightly for readability.
  • Log button is visible again in the Challenges.
  • The next/previous project buttons were fixed.
  • The search for projects is directly in the navigation.
  • "People" instead of Profile in the navigation.
  • Show roles and query in participant search.
  • Search usability slightly improved.
  • Show only 3 resource tips in project log.
  • Forms have a more consistent style overall.
  • Removed 125% default font size on projects.
  • Improved help for uploading data packages.
  • Home page rendering of resource areas and my projects changed.
  • People can be searched by skill (*) and role (~).
  • Link from project skillset to people-search.
  • Project page rendering of resource tips improved.
  • Instead of "Profile" there is a link to Dash (sprint dashboard) in the footer.
  • Event owners can approve and edit all projects.
  • Python library updates.

Example of a generated challenge - direct to slides:

What's Changed

  • EasyMDE support https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/pull/481
  • Link resolving https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/pull/480
  • Registration and approval https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/pull/475
  • See logs while posting https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/pull/476
  • Search and navigation https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/pull/477
  • Better nudging by https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/pull/478

Full Changelog: https://github.com/dribdat/dribdat/compare/v0.8.8...v0.8.9

entry.title: New release for Dribdat: v0.9.0
entry.content:
This release adds a slide render mode, so that presentations you create (or generate) in the hackathon tool can be embedded externally. An issue preventing Categories at global level being displayed has been addressed. Further UI refinements to address accessibility and layout, improving navigation flow across projects/logs. Infrastructure improvements include out-of-the-box Backboard integration, updated Data Package source URLs, and refreshed Python/JS dependencies. Documentation and contributor workflows clarified. We have moved deployment tools into the /scripts folder.

üåê Try it at demo.dribdat.cc

üèÄ Download from Docker Hub, GitHub or Codeberg.

üíö Thanks to the Open Farming Hackdays, Hack4SocialGood 2025 and Smart Regio Lab Lenzburg for the many suggestions and practical support of this release.

üëÅÔ∏è‚Äçüó®Ô∏è Please leave us your feedback in the Discussion area!

Improvements

  • Slides render mode
  • Global categories are now shown again in tabs and API for every event.
  • Adds CORS to the embed URL, because we often want to embed the slides elsewhere.
  • Moves the various shell and deployment scripts into the /scripts folder.
  • Makes the Contributor Code an uppercase filename.
  • Activation screen as workaround for unusable login code.
  • Makes the navigation bar easier to use in dark mode.
  • Minor code refactoring (linting) of the user models.
  • Coincides with the latest update of Backboard
  • Set Project header image to the image used in the latest Drib - unless users upload another image directly.
  • If a BACKBOARD_URL parameter is set, show a button with auto-configuration of Backboard.
  • Data Package format updated - source URL is now the local server.
  • Captcha more visible, fails message improved.
  • Dark mode navigation bar rendering fixed.
  • E-mail max length issue in login fixed.
  • Authentication code linted for readability & refactoring.
  • Redundant SYNCED messages no longer shown in the log.
  • Project navigation improved in Post and Log.
  • Default styles improved for Bootswatch compatibility.
  • About page and search controls tweaked.
  • Freshens up the Python and JS libraries.
  • Code coverage up to 70%.
  • Footer links revised.
  • README updated.
